title: Cut locus (Riemannian manifold)
summary: In Riemannian geometry, the cut locus of a point p {\displaystyle p} in a manifold is roughly the set of all other points for which there are multiple minimizing geodesics connecting them from p {\displaystyle p} , but it may contain additional points where the minimizing geodesic is unique, under certain circumstances.  The distance function from p is a smooth function except at the point p itself and the cut locus.
